text: Wanda Hazel Gág ( ; March 11, 1893 – June 27, 1946) was an American artist, author, translator, and illustrator. She is famous for making the children's book Millions of Cats, which is the oldest American picture book that is still being printed.Gregory, Alice. "Juicy As a Pear: Wanda Gág's Delectable Books". The New Yorker, April 24, 2014. Two of her books were given Newbery Honors and two were given Caldecott Honors. The New York Public Library included Millions of Cats on its 2013 list of the 100 Great Children's Books. ==References== Category:1893 births Category:1946 deaths Category:American illustrators Category:American children's writers
title: Wanda Gág
